general_advisory: Farmers are advised to proceed with sowing of Rabi pulses, oilseeds, and vegetables. Proper field surveillance for pests and diseases is recommended. Micronutrient deficiency may occur in crops due to waterlogged soil conditions.

advisory: Harvest rice crops which have reached 85% maturity and dry to proper moisture levels for consumption and seed purposes.
Grow short-duration Rabi crops like Green gram, Black gram, Cowpea, Field pea, Lentil, Groundnut, Tori.
Properly utilize soil moisture for sowing oilseeds in medium/shallow lowlands.
Sow vegetables considering the current weather conditions and soil moisture.
Grow high-yielding varieties like T 9, PU 11, PU 19 for green gram.
Grow high-yielding varieties like T 9, PU 11, PU 19, PU 30 for black gram.
Consider suitable varieties for the region and manage soil moisture for cowpea cultivation.
Utilize available soil moisture for successful field pea growth.
Ensure proper soil moisture for lentil cultivation.
Use appropriate groundnut varieties suitable for the region.
Sow Tori crops with consideration to the soil condition and moisture levels.
Control wilt and rot diseases in Brinjal through proper management practices.
Control wilt and rot diseases in Tomato through proper management practices.
Install traps for thrips infestation and use chemical control for effective management.
Manage Red Spider Mites in Marigold flowers through proper spray techniques.
Manage Red Spider Mites in Rose flowers through proper spray techniques.
Treat fish ponds against fungal, bacterial, and parasitic diseases during winters for better fish health.
